The '''sword of [[Manwë]]''' was a [[:Category:Weapons|weapon]] that the said [[Valar|Vala]] carried with him during the [[War of the Powers]], and which was later used by his herald [[Eönwë]] during the [[War of Wrath]].

== History ==
The first mention of such a weapon occurred during the [[War of the Powers]], where it is said:

{{blockquote|It came to pass that at last the gates of [[Utumno]] were broken and its halls unroofed, and [[Melkor]] took refuge in the uttermost pit. Thence, seeing that all was lost (for that time), he sent forth on a sudden a host of [[Balrogs]], the last of his servants that remained, and they assailed the standard of Manwë, as it were a tide of flame. But they were withered in the wind of his wrath and '''slain with the lightning of his sword'''; and Melkor stood at last alone.|''[[Morgoth's Ring]]'', "[[Annals of Aman]]"<ref>{{AA|50}}, p. 75</ref>}}

Afterwards, millennia later, it is said that Manwë gave his sword to [[Eönwë]] his herald,<ref>{{WJ|Last}}, p. 246</ref> who led the [[Host of the Valar]] during the [[War of Wrath]], where [[Morgoth]] was finally defeated.<ref>{{S|Earendil}}</ref>
